statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Arkansas 83, SC-Upstate 63
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. -- Marshawn Powell scored 19 points as Arkansas won Mike Anderson's first game as coach 83-63 over South Carolina-Upstate on Friday night. Rickey Scott added 11 points for the Razorbacks (1-0), who opened the game 10 of 11 shooting and pulled away late for the season-opening win over the Spartans (0-1). It was Anderson's first regular-season contest at Arkansas since serving as the school's interim coach for two games following former coach Nolan Richardson's firing in 2002. Richardson was in attendance to watch his former longtime assistant, who left Missouri in March to return to the school where he was an assistant for 17 seasons. The Razorbacks led by as many as 19 points in the first half and never led by less than double figures in the second half. Arkansas shot 52 percent, holding SC-Upstate to 37 percent and forcing 19 turnovers. Fred Miller led the Spartans with 10 points.
